Mechanical Service Engineer

Company Name Print & Pack Australia Pty Ltd Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 156 views

Job description

Mechanical Service Engineer

Job Type: Full Time

Location: Melbourne, Victoria

\xa0

Join one of Australia’s leading suppliers to the Graphic Art’s Industry!


We are currently seeking an experienced, confident and motivated Mechanical Service Engineer to join our team located in Melbourne, VIC.


Whilst this is a Melbourne based position travel both Interstate and International will be involved periodically.


Reporting to the Managing Director, you will provide:


  • Mechanical service to customers within Australia & New Zealand.
  • \xa0Attend to installations of equipment as directed.
  • Address warranty issues as required.
  • Provide service and technical support to all our customers in Australia & New Zealand.
  • Transfer and exchange technical skills to engineers within the service team
  • Interact and communicate with OEM’s on Technical problems and potential solutions
  • Make recommendations on solutions to problems after consultation with peers and factory engineers.


Your Profile (Skills & Attributes):


  • Completed trade apprenticeship in Mechanical.
  • Have a sound Mechanical Background and Certification to “A” grade mechanical engineering level with preferably strong electrical skills.
  • Performed service and installation work on printing and packaging equipment throughout the international network is desirable.
  • Strong technical experience.
  • Mechanical and technical minded with a proactive attitude.
  • Excellent communication and customer service skills.
  • Able to work as part of a wider team.
  • Able to interact independently at all levels within the company.
  • Electrical knowledge /experience will also be considered favourably.


In return for your above skills and experience you will be rewarded with an excellent salary package and full time employment with a market leader. The organisation offers a fun and dynamic environment with flexible working arrangements. You will be part of an international organisation.


If this sounds like you, please submit a cover letter and resume using the Apply Now button!


Please note that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

\xa0

Industrial Designer / Project Manager

Company Name Dot Design Group Pty Ltd Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 142 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Mid-Senior Industrial Designer/Project Manager


This is your chance to join a dynamic team of designers in a fast-growing industrial design studio.


Dot Design Group Melbourne is looking for a qualified Industrial Designer. In this role, you will work across the full design and manufacturing process; from initial ideation through to detailed engineering, estimating, supplier and key stakeholder management, manufacturing and product delivery. The ability to deliver creative solutions, on-time and to budget is essential.


We are seeking the following skills and attributes:


  • A tertiary qualification in Industrial Design
  • Minimum of 3 years’ experience in a similar position and industry
  • Hands-on knowledge of working with timber, steel and acrylic
  • Experience in managing local and offshore suppliers
  • Proficient in Solidworks and Adobe Creative Suite
  • Strong detailing & production skills
  • Strong communication and teamwork skills
  • Creative, resourceful and solutions-focused
  • Hands-on attitude

\xa0

Above all else, the successful candidate will need a positive attitude, a willingness to learn, and demonstrate a passion for design.

Remuneration negotiable based on experience.


** No Working Visa Applicants please ***


How to apply:

Please send your resume, portfolio and cover letter addressing the criteria above to: melhiring@dotdesign.com.au.


Please ensure your attachments do not exceed 7mb in total.


About Us:

Established in 2000, Dot Design Group is a market-leading design and manufacturing agency specialising in brand activation and visibility via Retail and Point-Of-Purchase displays. We have many long-standing and successful relationships with global brands in the FMCG, Retail and Health sectors. We take pride in delivering creative solutions to complex problems.

\xa0

Job description

Contract opportunity for an experienced Front End Developer to join a Global Digital Leading agency


  • Plan, develop and deliver high-performing web solutions
  • Project Driven Work
  • Central Melbourne location


Leading Digital innovator are seeking an experienced Front End Developer to join their bright-minded and collaborative team.

The successful applicant will be given the opportunity to contract for 3-6 months and work with an incredibly renowned brand and collaborate with a high performance team of Developers, UX professionals and Project Managers to produce beautiful and efficient products and services.

This chance to work with a leading innovator and a global creative organisation will be highly sought after so do not hesitate to apply quickly as this is an Urgent Requirement and interviews will proceed immediately.

To Be successful, you MUST have the following skills/experience:

  • 5+ years development experience in JavaScript frameworks, especially on enterprise-level mobile/responsive website projects.

  • Strong understanding of performance and optimisation.
  • Desire to learn and embrace new technologies, strong communication skills, and exceptional attention to detail.
Above all. You will have solid commercial experience with modern Front End Technologies and be passionate about your work!

This opportunity is only available to candidates who are Australian Citizens or PR holders. Only candidates with local experience will be considered.

851270310:

Assistant Store Manager

Company Name Prada Group Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 80 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Unfortunately, we are only able to consider applications of people who already have an appropriate visa to live and work in Australia.\xa0


Prada is one of the world's leading luxury brands. \xa0We are presently looking for an Assistant Store Manager to join our beautiful store in Prada Chadstone.


Reporting directly into the Store Manager, the Assistant Store Manager is responsible for contributing to the overall success of the Prada store. \xa0The Assistant Store Manager will promote brand loyalty to new and existing customers in order to guarantee Financial Targets and KPIs that have been set by the Company. \xa0The Assistant Store Manager will act as an Ambassador for Prada and represents the Company by following policies developed by HQ and ensuring that all staff within their team are capable of providing the best customer\xa0service, understanding their product and maintaining company standards at all times.


The primary responsibilities of the role are:


Customer Service and Sales

\xa0

Guarantees excellent customer service and supervises sales to ensure customer satisfaction\xa0

Ensures that all delicate situations regarding customer complaints and the overall sales process are dealt with accordingly.

Reflects the corporate image and ensures that the team is also aligned.

Ensures that the image of the store is in line with corporate standards and that the Staff is aware of this standard.


Team Management / Leadership\xa0

Defines the monthly/quarterly store’s objectives and ensures they are achieved by analysing the results, verifying monthly activities

Keeps staff informed at all times regarding store, department and individual performance through the necessary tools.

Ensures professional growth and training of the staff and drives a strong sales and service culture.

Deals with store administration and accounting responsibilities.\xa0Ensures Prada’s internal procedures and processes are followed within the store.

Reports all relevant information to Head Office/Headquarters.


Sales analysis and reporting

Maintains knowledge of store’s targets and actual sales results

Informs Retail Operations about any local events in the city and organised by competitors.


Product Management

Supervises stock levels and ensures that it is in line with the store’s sales potential and reports to Retail Merchandising accordingly.

Takes all the necessary measures to guarantee the safety of the products and all valuable materials in the store\xa0

Managing regular Stocktake activities


Teamwork

Participates in Department and Store sales meetings

Collaborates in a positive manner with Retail Operations, store management and colleagues at all times

Contributes to an overall positive atmosphere in the store


Any other responsibility as required



Please note we do not accept CVs submitted by agencies, and do not require the assistance of any third party for this particular search.

Company Name Cygnet Accounting Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 60 views

Job description

We currently have an amazing opportunity for a proactive and motivated individual to join our vibrant team as the Office Manager/EA to the Directors. This is a varied role with constant activity to keep you challenged and growing, within a down-to-earth and supportive team culture. \xa0


The responsibilities and daily tasks of this role will include:


  • Ensure the smooth running of the office day to day
  • Answer, screen and forward any incoming phone calls
  • Coordinating multiple calendars - managing appointments & booking meeting rooms,
  • Developing and implementing a broad range of initiatives,
  • ATO & ASIC correspondence and lodgements,
  • Building maintenance,
  • Minute taking for board meetings,
  • Maintaining and ordering office and kitchen supplies
  • Planning and organising team & client events
  • Marketing; including managing social media profiles and client newsletter,
  • Other general administrative duties and support as required.


Our ideal candidate will have previous experience in a similar role and a positive approach to carrying out your daily duties. You will have:


  • Outstanding communication skills;
  • A positive and professional attitude;
  • Strong attention to detail;
  • The ability to multitask and prioritise;
  • Flexibility and willingness to take on additional tasks as required;
  • The ability to work both independently and in a team environment.
  • A creative and analytical mind who can spot inefficiencies and suggest improvements;
  • Previous experience within the financial services industry will be highly regarded.


If you feel you meet the above criteria and want to play an integral role in the ongoing success of a young and exciting practice, who truly cares about their people, apply today!

852058894:
[

Account Executive

Company Name SearchWorks Pty Ltd Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 22 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

The Client:

Our client is an established and rapidly growing manufacturing company with offices around the globe. They and are looking to expand their sales team with the addition of a professional BDM in Sydney to sell a range of high-quality construction chemicals and concrete admixtures. They have a well-recognised product range that can be found in both commercial and residential buildings.


This role has materialised through sustained growth in the NSW market and the successful applicants will be joining a financially stable and growing business at a key stage in the company's expansion.


The Role:

Covering Sydney's Western and Northern metro area this role is focused on winning specifications with architects and consulting engineers as well as dealing with protecting Builders, Contractors, Concrete Manufacturers and Installers. The diversity of the role will offer an opportunity to sell on a technical, creative and commercial level depending on the application of the project you are pitching for.


Day to day you will be calling on all of the above contacts winning and breaking specifications, tracking projects through and managing the relationships with the installers.


The Successful Applicant:

You will be an up-and-coming sales professional and will have a good understanding of how to influence a buyer and structure a commercial sale.

You will be a comfortable presenter, a natural rapport builder and you will be looking to work for a fast-growing company with strong brands and products you can really be proud of. You will play the long game with your customers and understand the importance of established and committed relationships. Ideally, you will come from a sales role within the Commercial construction and you will have a knowledge of Concrete and the applications.
